steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"e5c96","text":"Harvest lymph nodes (superficial cervical, mandibular, axillary, inguinal, and mesenteric) from mice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"1A635DAA23024F198B09341CCA4A007A","id":664736,"previous_id":null,"previous_guid":null,"section":"Isolation of CD4+ Cells From Lymph Nodes"}
steps.section: Isolation of CD4+ Cells From Lymph Nodes

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"58btu","text":"Tease lymph nodes through a sterile 70-\u00b5m nylon cell strainer to obtain single-cell suspensions in complete IMDM containing 10% FCS (complete medium).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"57B4C7A19C08422DBCEFA7F25F22A13C","id":664737,"previous_id":664736,"previous_guid":"1A635DAA23024F198B09341CCA4A007A","section":"Isolation of CD4+ Cells From Lymph Nodes"}
steps.section: Isolation of CD4+ Cells From Lymph Nodes

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"3i38j","text":"Resuspend cells in complete medium and use your favorite method to isolate CD4+cells. Consider using ourMojoSort\u2122 Mouse CD4 T Cell Isolation Kit.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":78,"length":1,"style":"sup"},{"offset":104,"length":40,"style":"UNDERLINE"}],"entityRanges":[{"offset":104,"length":40,"key":0}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"url":"https:\/\/www.biolegend.com\/mojosort-mouse-cd4-t-cell-isolation-kit-11870.html"}}],"guid":"B96D432FD3054126B62802DCE0BFBA3E","id":664738,"previous_id":664737,"previous_guid":"57B4C7A19C08422DBCEFA7F25F22A13C","section":"Isolation of CD4+ Cells From Lymph Nodes"}
steps.section: Isolation of CD4+ Cells From Lymph Nodes

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"2ql4b","text":"On day 0, coat 60 x 15mm of plastic petri dishes with anti-mouse CD3\u03b5, clone 145-2C11 (5\u00b5g\/ml). Incubate at 37\u00b0C for 2 hours or 4\u00b0C overnight. Aseptically decant antibody solution from the plate. Wash plate 3 times with sterile PBS. Discard liquid.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ehem6","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"c2124","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":0,"guid":"492FC6D0B85C11E89B370B29455BC959","duration":7200,"label":"","step_guid":"DAC9B84D10CA4D2097477617C3443158"}}],"guid":"DAC9B84D10CA4D2097477617C3443158","id":664739,"previous_id":664738,"previous_guid":"B96D432FD3054126B62802DCE0BFBA3E","section":"Th17 Polarization of CD4+ Cells"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fq3p1","text":"Plate CD4+cells at 10 x 106\/5 ml\/dish. Culture cells for 4 days in the presence of anti-mouse CD28, clone 37.51 (5\u00b5g\/mL), recombinant mouse IL-6 (50ng\/mL), recombinant human TGF-\u03b21 (1ng\/mL), recombinant mouse IL-23 (5ng\/ml), anti-mouse IL-4 (10\u00b5g\/mL), and anti-mouse IFN-\u03b3 (10\u00b5g\/mL).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":9,"length":1,"style":"sup"},{"offset":26,"length":1,"style":"sup"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"410B993109014568ADD6F5D9CFF9755E","id":664740,"previous_id":664739,"previous_guid":"DAC9B84D10CA4D2097477617C3443158","section":"Th17 Polarization of CD4+ Cells"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"disrn","text":"On day 3, slowly add 5ml of fresh media along with same the concentration of antibodies\/cytokines as used on day 0.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"3CA6CDBAAD614CD0BDD44096407DAA11","id":664741,"previous_id":664740,"previous_guid":"410B993109014568ADD6F5D9CFF9755E","section":"Th17 Polarization of CD4+ Cells"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2nrlt","text":"On day 4, wash cells once and then restimulate in complete medium with 500ng\/ml PMA and 500ng\/mL ionomycin, in the presence of Brefeldin A (If you are looking for IL-21 production, use monensin) for 4-5 hours.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"b993h","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"cv9gt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":0,"guid":"3F5EA770B85C11E89B370B29455BC959","duration":18000,"label":"","step_guid":"253B9AC01ABD4158803540C9EFE85252"}}],"guid":"253B9AC01ABD4158803540C9EFE85252","id":664742,"previous_id":664741,"previous_guid":"3CA6CDBAAD614CD0BDD44096407DAA11","section":"Th17 Polarization of CD4+ Cells"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"18dfr","text":"After harvesting, the cells are ready for staining.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"17duf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"a17mf","text":"Tip: Recombinant human TGF-\u03b2 is effective for stimulating mouse cells.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":5,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"4F81DEC7DD584C419700A8622FFB8865","id":664743,"previous_id":664742,"previous_guid":"253B9AC01ABD4158803540C9EFE85252","section":"Th17 Polarization of CD4+ Cells"}
